Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Suprised”
Reviews.Author: maryb8355
Reviews.Content: This was not a hotel I would of picked if there would of been any others reasonably priced for the time we had to go to Dubai, but I was pleasantly surprised! After reading the reviews both here on Trip Advisor and a few other sites I was skeptical about the place. Check in was fast and efficient. Porter met us at the cab and tried to take our luggage (we only had carry ons so not necessary) and help us to our room. We declined. When we got to the room we were pleasantly surprised by the cleanliness and the size of the room. We had a room with a king bed and there was a small sofa in the room also. There was plenty of room in the room for two people to manuever without running into each other. There was no top sheet on the bed but I called housekeeping and one was provided immediately and was put on each day after that. There was a very nice blanket in the room - despite what the other reviewers said - and even and extra comforter in the closet. The bathroom was huge by hotel standards. It was a little dated - old fixtures - but in good repair. There was a small tub and shower and a huge sink area. The only problem when we got there was they only provided two large type bath towels, no hand towels or wash cloths (not many hotels in the Middle East provide wash cloths even if you ask) again I called housekeeping and they immediately brought us hand towels and again provided daily afterwards. The water pressure was horrible but was enough to take a shower even an extended one to make up for the lacking pressure and the hot water lasted the entire time, even though the second shower. There is a restaurant on site but did not eat there - mostly Indian and Filipino food. There are plenty of places within walking distance to go to also. City Center mall is only a short taxi ride away (we paid 10 AED for the trip there) and it has a lot of places to eat also. The Metro station is very close (about a 5 minute walk) and goes to everything in the city (even the airport!). There is a bakala (store) about a minute from the hotel and carries everything you might of forgotten or need (such as soda, instant coffee, etc., etc.) We were on the 7th floor and never heard any noise from the night club our entire stay. We did not go there so cannot tell you if it was as bad as the other people say it is. If you don't like that kind of thing stay away from it. Overall I say it is an okay hotel lost in a city with many luxury hotels. It is a little dated and needs some work but if you are looking for a cheap place to stay in the heart of the city then you might consider this one.

Reviews.Title: “Just Terrible”
Reviews.Author: potkan
Reviews.Content: My parents stayed in this hotel recently and asked me to write a review to warn everyone who might want to stay in this hotel in spite of the other poor reviews. Their room was filthy; the bathroom was spotted with mould. There are night clubs located at lower hotel levels and noise is coming from the street as well. Luckily, they stayed there only for night night while waiting for another flight.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Roxana2
Reviews.Content: Inspite of being a 3* hotel, its facilities were good, however no blanket were available so I couldnot sleep well. Lower floors were too noisy at night due to clubs.

Reviews.Title: “Boycott this hotel, stop the trade in human beings”
Reviews.Author: SteamyKabul
Reviews.Content: There are lots of good reasons to stay here, it is good value for money, and as good a place as any to stay in Dubai. The place is so spread out that you need to take transport where ever you stay, taxis are frequent and numerous. Two downsides to the hotel, the first was lack of hot water, the hot tap only supplied luke warm water and the reception seemed to be not fussed to fix it. By far the biggest problem are the night clubs on the lower floors, They are nothing more that auction room for south Asian sex workers, the men who attend the clubs bid for the girls over the course of the evening. Watching this was nothing short of distressing, the girls sit on a long bench at the back of the stage and take their turn to dance in front of the men over the course of the night, while the men place bids. If the girls want to leave the stage for a drink they must ask permission. The girls seem to be indentured to the club. Online booking agents should have some policy for checking that hotels do not infringe human decency and freedoms, this hotel should be withdrawn from such websites.

Reviews.Title: “Just do not go there, Terrible”
Reviews.Author: aminsmiley
Reviews.Content: I was there from November 22 to 27 2010, When I wanted to go to airport, I forgot to take one of my bags, I called them from my country but they didnt care. I am sure I left it there. The building is old has very bad service and the most important one is that your bags may get stolen. Just don't go there.

Reviews.Title: “not happy about customer interaction”
Reviews.Author: hibimal
Reviews.Content: i visited their indian dance bar this months and got to know that u need t to spend money on the girls otherwise they will not serve u the drink...and if u will not give the tips to th waiter they may beat you too.... i tried reaching their management to complaint about this but did not get any positive response.

Reviews.Title: “" Worst Hotel I have ever stayed at"”
Reviews.Author: SkipSydney
Reviews.Content: This Hotel looks nothing like the photo's show, it is Dark, not much natural light enters, staff were not very nice apart from one Lady who helped us with regards to getting boiled water for our baby. Alot of noise from the night club very smoky. Luckly we only had one night otherwise we would 've considered moving to another hotel. The Room was small, bathroom could do with some renovations. Also the Pool is tiny and pretty much usless, looked a bit like a building site around the pool area.

Reviews.Title: “A decent hotel, just a place to stay and sleep for few nights”
Reviews.Author: aliamiri
Reviews.Content: Well, we were a group of 12 persons from DPI Co. (the company which I work for) who traveled to Dubai to visit GITEX exhibition on October 2008. It was an organized tour and paid by company, so I have no exact information regarding the price. The Orchid Hotel Dubai is a decent 3* hotel but in a good area. It's not acutually luxury; it's just a cheap (relational to prices in Dubai) place to stay and sleep for few nights. If you're on business in Dubai for maximum one week and you're looking for a budget hotel then Orchid is a good one. The noise problem that many users mentioned in this forum is still there, but mostly for the 2nd and 3rd floor. Our room (me and my colleague Maziar) was in the 4th floor and we could hear only a weak sound from night clubs in the first floor. The hotel serves buffet breakfast and lunch included in its price. The number of choices is not bad and foods are acceptable. The rooms are really small, but clean. The pool on rooftop is actually very small, not should call it a pool! The lobby is small in size and very decent. Taxi is a real problem in Dubai these days, and this hotel can't do anything for you too. But it has some regular van services to some shopping centers and beach that you can use. The location is good, in Deira and close to City Center and Al-Nasser sq. where many hotels are is sorroundings.

Reviews.Title: “really Terrible”
Reviews.Author: Fariborz
Reviews.Content: hotel reception was not polite .first night we could not sleep at all because of load disco sound . shower room was disappointing . breakfast was OK but lunch was terrible .we told them to change our room but they refused it !!! .i will never stay this hotel and i recommend to find another place to stay .

Reviews.Title: “What an experience”
Reviews.Author: Mcky
Reviews.Content: If you like russian prostitutes, dodgy bars with sheik-dressed man and if you don't fancy sleeping this is your place.

Reviews.Title: “The least customer service providing hotel I have ever visited”
Reviews.Author: nomad_highlander
Reviews.Content: The customer service is very poor and indifferent, including in the reception. Though the hotel is centrally located, do not be deceived because there are hardly any possibility to get a taxi and hotel does nothing to mitigate it especially when it comes to arranging the drop offs to the airport. So, be ready to overpay 4 times for the private vehicle to take you to the airport. Breakfast was bad. Seems also the emails the hotel provided are just for the decoration, because you should not expect that anybody will bother replying to them. If you go to relax and have the vacation without the need to settle the issues, avoid this hotel, because you will get issues.

Reviews.Title: “diappointed.”
Reviews.Author: fardad
Reviews.Content: my 4 day stay at Orchid was a nightmare which seemed never to end.tunfortunately i had to stay since i had prepaid .the service was bad.the reception was careless and instead of being helpful would try to bring excuses regarding the problems.the room was unclean..the food was not good at all.i felt decieved as i left this place.as i told the reception before leaving i would not recommend anyone to stay at Orchid.

Reviews.Title: “scalding hot water from both taps”
Reviews.Author: arkicon1
Reviews.Content: The first impression when you enter the reception lobby is a little alarming as you see giant posters of cabaret dancers. Especially when so many reviews mention the loud noise. And to add to your apprehensions, the lobby seems a little gaudy too. So I asked for a room as far away from the noise as possible and I got it without much ado. My room was nice and clean on the 5th floor, but the water was really hot so I turned on the cold water to neutralize it but to my surprise it was hotter, so I rang the concerned department and they switched off the boiler. I had to wait for an hour for the water to cool down. This exercise had to be done very morning and after a certain while I started feeling like boiled meat. It was certainly cumbersome to wait for the right temperature water to come so you could take a shower so inevitably risks had to be taken. Otherwise the staff was very polite and hospitable. The breakfast was very ordinary and it was a formality to have it, before you went out. My overall experience was OK!

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here if you have any option unless you are an insomniac”
Reviews.Author: Juzza1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel whilst in Dubai on business and unfortunately would have to say that the whole experience of my first visit to Dubai was overshadowed by the deafening noise from the disco which went on until the early hours of the morning on all four nights that I stayed at the hotel. Despite of the fact that my colleague and I asked to be moved after the first night, and were relocated to the 5th floor, the noise was still overwhelming. As there are many good alternative hotels available in Dubai, if a little expensive in the main, there really is no need to suffer the terrible noise at the Orchid. Avoid at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “Four Reasons”
Reviews.Author: Sohrob
Reviews.Content: a) Disco everynight from 10 pm to 3 am shakes your room, b) losing room key will cost you 100 Dhs = $27, c) no hot water, and d) no non-smoking rooms

Reviews.Title: “Orchid - Basic not Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: DS-TRFC
Reviews.Content: I picked the Orchid because it was close to the Al Bustan where I was attending a conference - but considerably cheaper! The rooms were basic but clean - which was all I was looking for. Don't expect a bell boy to assist you - there was one.....sometimes! Several night clubs on 1st floor - which is not unusual for 3 star hotels in Dubai. Due to my attending social functions which ended late, I can't comment on the noise from the clubs as they had finished by the time I returned to the hotel. The particular thing I enjoyed about this hotel is that they serve food until 4.30am in a small restaurant in the lobby - where there is a great mix of people. I particularly recommend the spicy beef and fried rice.....tasted great in the early hours - and sent me to bed satisfied! I wouldn't recommend this hotel if you are trying to impress that special person in your life - but for the single business traveler who doesn't plan to spend too much time in it - it's fine and good value by the ever increasing Dubai price standards. I would return......but only for the spicy beef!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: Roobles
Reviews.Content: My heart sank as we pulled up. Smell of smoke in the room and damp. No hot water, loud music all night. I booked it through the virgin website, looking for a fairly cheap long weekend. After two nights (I'm sure it was full of prostitutes at night) we ran screaming and blew all our cash on the Jumeriah Beach Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Won't Rush Back”
Reviews.Author: thedhonn
Reviews.Content: A group of five of us stayed at the Orchid for 3 nights at the end of February 06. We had all been to a wedding in India and were looking for a few days to chill before returning home. We were a mixed group of males and females and of ages. We found the staff to be pleasant and helpful. The hotel has 3 nightclubs all based on the First Floor and they are all open till the early hours of the morning. We had rooms on both the 4 and 5 floors and 4 of the party required ear plugs to ensure a good night sleep. The breakfast buffy is very basic and is served in Cindy's Phillipino Night Club. Interesting having breakfust under ultra violet lights and sitting with people in their night clothes. All things considered if you are looking for a hotel close to the airport for 1 or 2 nights then this hotel is okay. However we are sure that if you search the web you will find nicer and more reasonably priced hotels. Our rooms cost approx £90/night including breakfast. We intend to return to Dubai but will look for a better hotel next time.
